hackathon-description-text: Hackathons are for designing, creating, and building awesome projects. HackEDbeta is a welcoming event that provides a great learning environment for students from any program of study or school (including our high school friends!) Whether or not you have programmed before does not matter! We want you here regardless your level of experience!
hackathon-eligibility: Everyone is welcome to enter, students up to masters students are eligible to win prizes or students who have graduated within the past year.
hackathon-requirements: Projects must be submitted to Devpost by Noon on Sunday, November 19th and projects must be publically visible on Github and linked to Devpost.
hackathon-rules:
Teams can be up to 5 but as little as 1 participant.
Minimum of 50% of your team must be an onsite participant.
All participants (mentors included) must adhere to the
All code must be written at the event during the hackathon time frame.
Mentors and Sponsors are welcome to help projects and provide support.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=10359 104 St NW #301, Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How much did the participants have to learn in order to implement this hack?

hackathon-location-address: 10359 104 St NW #301, Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9, Canada
hackathon-description-header: The annual 24-hour hackathon for novice hackers, first time programmers, and people to try something new.
